<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 1+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Cantrip Deck](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1046)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 181 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

In an effort to spread the knowledge of magic as widely as possible, worshippers of [Nethys](/Deities.aspx?ID=12) discovered a way to bind cantrips into cards accessible even to non-spellcasters. The deck contains thick parchment cards, each roughly half the size of a playing card. In precise, no-nonsense script, each card simply states the name of its cantrip, color-coded based on its school.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action or more Actions" /> (envision, Interact);     **Effect** You envision your desired cantrip, causing its card to rise to the top of the deck, and draw the card. The deck casts that cantrip as a 1st-level spell, with a DC of 15 and a spell attack modifier of +5. The card crumbles into dust as the cantrip takes effect. The activation takes the same number of actions as the cantrip you chose takes to cast.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

---

This pack contains 5 cards of a single common cantrip (such as [_light_](/Spells.aspx?ID=171)).

>

</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 181 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 20 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

This pack contains 24 cards—one of each cantrip in the _Core Rulebook_.
